SEG.ORIGINAL_TEXT: Nigeria can’t battle Boko Haram alone, APC blasts Buhari critics
<b>Nigeria can’t battle Boko Haram alone, APC blasts Buhari critics<b>

The All Progressives Congress (APC) has hailed President Muhammadu Buhari for his shuttle diplomacy aimed at forging a stronger regional front against the Boko Haram insurgency, saying the President should be praised rather than pilloried for his efforts.

”Boko Haram, which started off as a Nigerian problem, has now assumed a regional dimension, affecting many countries in West Africa. Therefore, any solution to the crisis, if it is to endure, must be regional in nature, with Nigeria taking the lead,” the party said in a statement issued in Abuja on Saturday by its National Publicity Secretary, Alhaji Lai Mohammed.

<b>Nigeria bombers 'faked fight' to attract people near Yola market<b>

Two suicide bombers killed at least 31 people and injured 38 others in a crowded market in the northeast Nigeria city of Yola after faking a fight, police said on Saturday.The bombers with explosives strapped to their bodies entered the Jimeta Main Market after sundown on Friday and "pretended to be fighting", said area police spokesman Othman Abubakar. <a href="http://www.dnaindia.com/sport/report-nigeria-bombers-faked-fight-to-attract-people-near-yola-market-2092909" target="_blank">http://www.dnaindia.com/sport/report...market-2092909</a>
